alert.note: Alert for Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Guilford. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, and more rain is expected over the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, Summerfield, Lake Townsend, Lake Townsend Marina, Haw River State Park, Lake Jeanette Marina, Monticello and Lake Brandt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
